intro: Stachytarpheta aristata, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered blue or purple flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a textured appearance. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value. Stachytarpheta aristata is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
